text:
Ended up with:
```      - uses: actions/cache@v2
        with:
          path: ~/.julia/artifacts
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-test-artifacts-${{ hashFiles('**/Project.toml') }}
          restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-test-artifacts```
So if a cache for the specific Project.toml exists, it'll take that one, and otherwise it'll take the newest `${{ runner.os }}-test-artifacts` cache. This page (<https://docs.github.com/en/actions/guides/caching-dependencies-to-speed-up-workflows#matching-a-cache-key>) explains how it works quite nicely.

elements.text:

        with:
          path: ~/.julia/artifacts
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-test-artifacts-${{ hashFiles('**/Project.toml') }}
          restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-test-artifacts
So if a cache for the specific Project.toml exists, it'll take that one, and otherwise it'll take the newest
) explains how it works quite nicely.

text: I recently tried caching the registry as well, with the hope it'd improve installation on Windows, but the problem is that the cache is a tarball, and unpacking tarballs on Windows is _slow_...
